basics.name: Kayla-Marie Torres
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024. I have a B.A. In Sociology.

work.position: Data Driven Agriculture Research and Extenstion Experiences for Undergraduates (REEU)
highlights: Innovative research team of 10 Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islanders across a 9 week program covering data collection in a greenhouse to data analyzing with R Studio. Worked as a cohort to build 5 posters to present at UH’s 2023 undergraduate summer research symposium. This internship fostered cohesiveness, teamwork, and stimulating scientific discussions. Included weekly field trips to non-profit organizations, research extensions, and industrial employers where we got a chance to network with potential employers and members of the community.

volunteer.organization: Native Hawaiians in Science and Engineering Mentorship Program (NHSEMP)
highlights: STEM Scholar- Creating leaders in the Native Hawaiian and Pacific Island communities through academic excellence in the fields of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics

FP404- Mentoring two students from Lana’i High School with their STEM senior project. During weekly meetings I guide
them on their Ma’i Project, where they are increasing access to feminine hygiene products on campus.

awards.title: Kamehameha Schools Scholarship
awards.summary: Helping nurture the dreams of Native Hawaiian learners.

awards.title: Starr Foundation Science and Technology Scholarship Fund
